title: continue inside closure argument inside loop causes an ICE: Invalid loop id for continue

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
this code causes an ICE on stable, beta, and rustc 1.28.0-nightly (f28c7aef7 2018-06-19):
```Rust
fn main() {
    while |_: [_; continue]| {} {}
}
```
Playground link: https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=844ad4dac23d572370f558638407ce82&version=nightly&mode=release

Backtrace:
```
error: internal compiler error: librustc_mir\hair\cx\expr.rs:551: invalid loop id for continue: not inside loop scope

thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors\lib.rs:554:9

#0 [mir_built] processing `main::{{closure}}::{{constant}}`
#1 [unsafety_check_result] processing `main::{{closure}}::{{constant}}`
#2 [mir_const] processing `main::{{closure}}::{{constant}}`

#6 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies
end of query stack
error: aborting due to previous error


note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.28.0-nightly (f28c7aef7 2018-06-19) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
```

This might be related to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/50576, but has been resolved in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/51070
